intro: Fornicium carthamoides, commonly known as the yellow oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring full sun and well-drained soil. Its bright yellow flowers with a central dark center bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Fornicium carthamoides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant appearance and hardy nature.
